etymology.description: 真(真) (zhēn, "real; true") + 的(的) (de, "of; possessive particle") = expresses the quality of being genuine or true -> really or truly.
etymology.interpretation: The word combines 真(真) (zhēn, "real; true") with 的(的) (de, "of; possessive particle") to emphasize the truth or genuineness of an assertion or statement.

examples.chinese: 我真的很高兴(我真的很高興)。
她真的喜欢这本书(她真的喜歡這本書)，因为它非常有趣(因為它非常有趣)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zhēn de xǐhuān zhè běn shū, yīnwèi tā fēicháng yǒuqù.
examples.english: She really likes this book because it is very interesting.
